answers.answer: To qualify for temporary protection in Romania, you must meet certain criteria and follow specific procedures. This includes being in a situation where your life and personal safety would be threatened if returned to your home country due to reasons such as war, violence, human rights violations, natural disasters, etc. Additionally, it may be possible to apply for temporary protection after entering Romania under other circumstances, including as a refugee or seeking international protection. You can also apply for asylum within Romania at a later stage.
answers.bResponse: To qualify for temporary protection in Romania, you must meet certain criteria and follow specific procedures. You can also apply for asylum within Romania at a later stage. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay

answers.answer: The benefits include being able to enter Romania with a valid passport, staying up to 90 days, access to social services such as food, clothing, personal hygiene products, primary healthcare, and treatment for acute or chronic illnesses. They also have the right to work in Romania without requiring a work permit, and can enroll their children in the Romanian education system. Additionally, Ukrainian nationals can benefit from medical assistance, including free medical care and treatment for life-threatening conditions, and accommodation costs may be reimbursed for hosts in the conflict zone in Ukraine.

answers.answer: Yes, there are some requirements needed to work legally in Romania. You need to apply for a work permit at the General Inspectorate for Immigration. Additionally, you may also need certain documents such as a labor contract, a picture from the general register of employees, a registered salary, and a medical certificate.
answers.bResponse: Yes, there are some requirements needed to work legally in Romania. You need to apply for a work permit at the General Inspectorate for Immigration. Additionally, you may also need certain documents such as a labor contract, a picture from the general register of employees, a registered salary, and a medical certificate. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay

answers.answer: Yes, when making requests for specific resources, it is important to follow the guidelines provided by Sprijin de Urgență. This includes being clear and detailed about what you are looking for and ensuring that your request aligns with their mission of supporting those in urgent need. Additionally, you should consider whether you will be able to pick up the requested items yourself or if transportation will be required.
